fast3d.util.serial

Class ObjFileLoader

  • java.lang.Object
    • fast3d.util.serial.ObjFileLoader

  • public abstract class ObjFileLoader
extends java.lang.Object
    loads an *.obj-file
    the filename does not have to end with *.obj / *.mtl, just the files content matters
    every "g"-tag will create a new fast3d.complex.Group and every "o"-tag will create a new fast3d.complex.Object
    every Group will be packed to the previously declared Object, every Object will be packed to one fast3d.complex.Scene
    the first undeclared group and object are called as the content of the unnamed field (should only be changed for good reason)
    Author:
    Tim Trense

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int indexOffset
      the offset to add to any index for vertices, normals and texture-coordinates
      default is -1 because many .obj-files implicitly define indices as 1-based but in this loader they are 0-based
      static java.lang.String unnamed
      the groupID or objectID if no other is specified in the file to load

      ObjFileLoader()

      creates a bufferedReader and calls load(reader) but in try-catch
      static Scene load(java.lang.String filename)
      creates a file with the given filename and calls load(file)
      static Scene load(java.lang.String dir, java.io.BufferedReader reader)
      reads the content of the reader and builds a Scene just as declared in the readers content

      • load

        public static Scene load(java.io.File f)
        creates a bufferedReader and calls load(reader) but in try-catch
        Parameters:
        f - the file containing the description of the object to load
        Returns:
        the Scene described in the *.obj-file

      • load

        public static Scene load(java.lang.String dir,
                         java.io.BufferedReader reader)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        reads the content of the reader and builds a Scene just as declared in the readers content
        Parameters:
        dir - the directory of the *.obj file
        reader - the description of the Scene
        Returns:
        the Scene described in the *.obj-file-bufferedReader
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if any io-exception occurs- that will be thrown
